name: Introduction to Astronomy
description: A course covering the basics of astronomy, including the structure of the universe, the various kinds of celestial objects within it, and the tools used to study them.

name: Astrophysics I
description: An introduction to the physical nature of the universe, including the structure and evolution of stars and stellar systems, the interstellar medium, and galaxies.

name: Astrophysics II
description: A continuation of Astrophysics I, covering topics such as binary stars, stellar evolution, the interstellar medium, high-energy astrophysics, and cosmology.

name: Exoplanet Astronomy
description: A course covering the basics of exoplanet astronomy, including the search for exoplanets, the physics of exoplanets, and the methods used to detect and characterize them.
